corporate.transactionCreated.hint: Transaction sent to bc-data with pay date: {{date}}
corporate.info: These are the corporate events we know about. Click the play button to dispatch a transaction to your portfolio. The effective date can be edited before processing.
corporate.reconciled.hint: Reconciliation status - shows if a matching transaction exists in your portfolio
corporate.backfill.hint: Process all missing events that are ready (effective pay date has passed)
corporate.portfolio.title: Portfolio Corporate Actions
corporate.portfolio.info: Scan your portfolio to find corporate actions (dividends, splits) that may not have been recorded as transactions.
corporate.portfolio.scan.prompt: Click the button below to scan all positions in this portfolio for missing corporate actions.
corporate.portfolio.noMissing: All corporate actions have been recorded. No missing events found.
corporate.portfolio.found: Found {{count}} missing corporate action(s) that can be processed.
rebalance.title: Rebalance Position
account.name: Asset Name
account.name.hint: Descriptive name (e.g., My USD Savings, Main Residence)
accounts.title: Custom Assets
accounts.name: Name
accounts.empty: You have no custom assets. Click Add Asset to create one.
accounts.edit.title: Edit Asset
accounts.delete.title: Delete Asset
accounts.delete.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this asset?
accounts.delete.warning: This action cannot be undone. Any transactions associated with this asset will remain but reference a deleted asset.
category.ACCOUNT.desc: Track savings, current, and fixed deposit accounts. Bank accounts always have a value of 1 per unit of currency.
category.TRADE.desc: Trading or brokerage accounts used for settling security transactions. Link these to portfolios for automatic cash settlement.
category.RE.desc: Real estate properties and land. Set periodic valuations to track property appreciation over time.
category.MUTUAL FUND.desc: Unlisted mutual funds and unit trusts. Set prices manually as these don't have market data feeds.
category.POLICY.desc: Insurance policies with cash value such as whole life or endowment policies. Track surrender values over time.
accounts.overview.title: Custom Assets
accounts.overview.description: Manage assets that are not traded on public exchanges. These include bank accounts, real estate, unlisted funds, and other private holdings.
accounts.tab.empty.hint: Click Add Asset to create one.
accounts.setBalances.title: Set Account Balances
accounts.setBalances.description: Set the balance for this account in each portfolio where it's held.
accounts.setBalances.notHeld: This account is not held in any portfolio.
accounts.setBalances.notHeld.hint: Add a transaction to a portfolio to start tracking this account.
price.set.title: Set Asset Price
price.error.invalid: Please enter a valid price greater than 0
costAdjust.title: Adjust Cost Basis
costAdjust.noChange: No change from current cost basis
costAdjust.warning.negative: Warning: New cost basis will be negative
costAdjust.error.noChange: Please enter a different cost basis
costAdjust.edit.help: Positive to increase cost basis, negative to decrease

accounts.import.select: Click or drop a CSV file here

allocation.description: View how your assets are distributed across all portfolios
allocation.groupBy.label: Group by
allocation.valueIn.label: Value in
displayCurrency.approximate: Values shown in display currency - Cost/Gains are approximate
admin.title: Admin
settings.title: Settings
settings.preferredName.description: How you'd like to be greeted in the app
settings.defaultHoldingsView.description: The view to show when opening the Holdings page
settings.defaultValueIn.description: The currency mode to show values in by default
settings.defaultGroupBy.description: How to group holdings by default
settings.baseCurrency.description: Currency for cost tracking and portfolio jurisdiction defaults
settings.reportingCurrency.description: Default currency for displaying portfolio values
settings.showWeightedIrr.description: Display market-value weighted IRR in group subtotals
settings.showWeightedIrr.tooltip: Weighted IRR is calculated as the sum of (position IRR × market value) divided by total market value. This gives larger positions more influence on the group average. Note: Cash positions are excluded as they have no meaningful IRR. This is an approximation and may differ from true time-weighted returns.
retire.monthlyExpenses.tooltip: Your total expected monthly spending after reaching independence, including housing, food, healthcare, and other regular costs.
retire.netMonthlyNeed.tooltip: What you need from your savings each month after accounting for pension, government benefits, and other income sources.
retire.equityReturn.tooltip: Expected yearly growth rate for stocks and equity investments. Historical average is around 7-10%.
retire.inflation.tooltip: Expected yearly increase in living costs. Your expenses will grow by this rate each year.
retire.targetBalance.tooltip: The amount you want to have left at the end of your planning period, for a legacy or safety buffer.
retire.assets.title: Assets by Category
retire.assets.selectCategories: Select which asset categories can be spent after reaching independence:
retire.assets.totalAssets.tooltip: The combined value of all your investments and assets, including property and other holdings.
retire.assets.spendable.tooltip: Assets that can be easily converted to cash for living expenses, like stocks, bonds, and savings.
retire.assets.nonSpendable.tooltip: Assets like property that grow in value but aren't available for everyday spending.
retire.assets.spendableAtRetirement.tool: Your projected liquid savings when you reach financial independence, after years of investment growth and contributions.
retire.assets.retirementInfo: You are {{currentAge}} now. Independence at age {{retirementAge}} ({{yearsToRetirement}} years)
retire.assets.noHoldings.hint: Add positions to your portfolios to see asset categories.
retire.projection.title: Projection
retire.projection.calculate: Calculate to see your independence projection
retire.projection.startingBalance.toolti: The amount of spendable savings you'll have at independence, including growth from contributions and investment returns.
retire.projection.propertyValue.tooltip: Assets like real estate that grow in value but aren't easily converted to cash for everyday expenses.
retire.projection.supportUntilAge.toolti: The age when your liquid savings are projected to run out, based on your spending, income, and investment returns.
retire.projection.yearsOfRunway.tooltip: How many years your savings will last from independence, accounting for inflation and investment growth.
retire.projection.howLongAssetsLast.tool: This shows how long your savings will last if you become independent today and follow this plan. It accounts for your income sources, expected returns, and rising costs over time.
retire.projection.runwayDescription: Based on {{currency}} {{expenses}}/month expenses minus income, with investment returns and inflation factored in
retire.projection.fundsDepletedAtAge.too: The age when your liquid savings are projected to reach zero. Compare this to your life expectancy to see if adjustments are needed.
retire.projection.surplusDeficit.tooltip: The difference between what you'll have at the end of your plan and what you wanted to have. A surplus means you're on track; a deficit means you may need to adjust.
What you're projected to have at the end of your planning period, after all withdrawals and investment growth.
retire.timeline.title: Wealth Timeline
